A website about various chess openings

Elephant Gambit

Mar 24, 2025

The Elephant Gambit is an uncommon gambit that arrives after the starting moves:

  1. e4 e5
  2. Nf3 d5 White can take either of the pawns on e5 or d5. Both of the pawns have the own unique challenges.

Duckduckgo results about Elephant Gambit

The Elephant Gambit (also called the Queenâ€™s Pawn Countergambit, Englund Counterattack or Turkish Gambit) is a rarely played chess opening beginning with the moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 d5?! The Elephant Gambit is generally considered unsound, with black typically unable to gain compensation for the sacrificed pawn.
